misuses.misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm.
misuses.description: The code uses a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm, specifically the JKS type, which has known vulnerabilities and should not be used in production environments.
misuses.recommendation: Replace JKS with a more secure algorithm, such as PKCS12.

misuses.misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation.
misuses.description: The code generates a random password, but uses a less-secure algorithm (String.valueOf(random.ints())) to do so, which may not provide adequate entropy.
misuses.recommendation: Use a more secure algorithm to generate the password, such as a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator.
